    • Constructor Detail

      • JSILearning

        public JSILearning(jstella.runner.JStellaMain JSMain)
        This method will be called by the JStella Emulator itself inside the JSMain class. It will then proceed to gather all necessary resources to facilitate the Agent and information requests for any game.

        The game and agent classes must be specified in this method.

        Parameters:
        JSMain - A copy of the main class controlling the JStella Emulator

    • Method Detail

      • doLearning

        public void doLearning()
        This is the primary method handling communication between the agent Class and the JStella Emulator. It will be automatically called by the JSConsole Class before each frame of the game is rendered and as such should never be called manually.

        Will call for the games state to be computed if any extra computation is needed. Then will query the agent for actions to send to the system. Additionally, this method keeps track of toggling image gathering on/off based on the Agents request.

      • sendInput

        public void sendInput(int[] actions)
        Processes any given input command by sending it to the JStella InputMaster Class directly as a key press event. This will result in the game performing the set of actions given. Subsequently, generates the key release event for the same key one frame later. If the same key is pressed for multiple consecutive frames the motion will appear seamless.
        Parameters:
        actions - an array of 1 to 3 integer key-codes that correspond to a given joystick action sent by the Agent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array supplied has invalid actions or is outside of the allowed size range

      • getGameImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGameImage()
        Returns a BufferedImage which is built as a composite of multiple images taken from the system separated by a number of game frames. Any pixel that is identical in all sample images will remain the same in the output image while any pixel that differs in one or more image will be red (Red (255,0,0) will never be displayed in any image as it is not a valid NTSC color).

        *Note: This method has a startup delay before it will return the first valid image of:
        (framesToAverage * frameSampleRate * frameDelay = delayInMilliseconds)
        If any call is made to this method before this time has elapsed it will return null.
        Returns:
        A composite image built from a set of images
        See Also:
        Color Information

      • getMemory

        public int[] getMemory()
        Returns the current memory space in use by the JStella system.
        Returns:
        an integer array of length 128

      • getMemoryAsHex

        public java.lang.String[] getMemoryAsHex()
        Returns the current memory space in use by the JStella system converted from integer values to Hex values.
        Returns:
        a String array of length 128

      • setframeSampleRate

        public void setframeSampleRate(int sampleRate)
        Sets the delay in frames between two consecutive image captures.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - the number of frames (must be in the range 1 to 10 inclusive)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is outside of the allowed range

      • getframeSampleRate

        public int getframeSampleRate()
        Returns the delay in frames between two consecutive image captures.
        Returns:
        an integer number of frames

      • setFramesToAverage

        public void setFramesToAverage(int numFrames)
        Sets the total number of frames to gather that will be part of the composite image.
        Parameters:
        numFrames - the number of frames (must be in the range 1 to 10 inclusive)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is outside of the allowed range

      • getFramesToAverage

        public int getFramesToAverage()
        Returns the total number of frames to gather that will be part of the composite image.
        Returns:
        an integer number of frames

      • setFrameDelay

        public void setFrameDelay(int myFrameDelay)
        Sets the time in milliseconds between each consecutively rendered frame. The default value is 17 milliseconds, or 60 frames a second. This value can be set as low as 1 millisecond, or 1000 frames a second. *Can be unstable when using a frame delay above 17
        Parameters:
        myFrameDelay - an integer delay that must be greater than 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is outside of the allowed range

      • getFrameDelay

        public int getFrameDelay()
        Returns the current delay in milliseconds between each frame.
        Returns:
        a number of milliseconds

      • setAgentCallDelay

        public void setAgentCallDelay(int myCallDelay)
        Sets how often the Agent is called in relation to the number of game frames executing.
        • 0 = no calls to Agent
        • 1 = one call to Agent every frame
        • n = one call to Agent every n frames
        Parameters:
        myCallDelay - an integer delay that must be non negative
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is outside of the allowed range

      • getAgentCallDelay

        public int getAgentCallDelay()
        Returns the current delay between consecutive Agent calls.
        Returns:
        a number of frames

      • getROMPlayableStatus

        public boolean getROMPlayableStatus()

        Returns:
        a status of the game

      • getROMValidActions

        public int[][] getROMValidActions()
        Returns the set of valid actions in the loaded ROM

        The only possible actions are combinations of 1 to 3 commands at once (limited by the joystick) from the options:
        • NULL
        • UP
        • DOWN
        • LEFT
        • RIGHT
        18 Total Actions Possible
        Returns:
        a set of actions that can be taken in the game

      • getROMState

        public int[] getROMState()
        Returns the state representation of the game as determined by the games class.
        Returns:
        the state of the game
